eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.layout

Class HCPSplitLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.layout.HCPSpacedLayout
      • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.layout.HCPSplitLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HCPLayout

    public class HCPSplitLayout
extends HCPSpacedLayout
    A layout algorithm which splits the available space equally among the elements, regardless of their preferred size.

    Always paints all elements unless there is not enough space for the spacing alone, in which case nothing is painted.

    This class is immutable.

      Returns an HCPSplitLayout instance which maintains the specified spacing between two adjacent elements.
      float getSize(float[] sizes)
      Returns the total size that this layout would need to optimally lay out the specified elements.

        public static HCPSplitLayout getInstance()

      • getInstance

        public static HCPSplitLayout getInstance(float spacing)
        Returns an HCPSplitLayout instance which maintains the specified spacing between two adjacent elements.
        Parameters:
        spacing - must be >= 0
        Returns:
        an instance with the specified spacing
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if spacing is < 0

      • getSize

        public float getSize(float[] sizes)
        Description copied from interface: HCPLayout
        Returns the total size that this layout would need to optimally lay out the specified elements. This method takes shrinking and stretching as well as gaps introduced by the layout into account.
        Parameters:
        sizes - the sizes of the individual elements
        Returns:
        the total size needed to lay out these elements

      • apply

        public HCPLayoutResults apply(HCPLayoutSpace space,
                              float[] sizes)
        Description copied from interface: HCPLayout
        Applies this layout algorithm to the specified elements and places them in the specified layout space.
        Parameters:
        space - the space in which the elements should be placed
        sizes - the sizes of the individual elements
        Returns:
        an HCPLayoutResults instance containing the results of the layout process
